contentList.content: You gain three Wildshape Charges per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, which allow you to turn into various animals.
You gain three Fungal Symbiosis Charges per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, which allow you to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_SymbioticEntity">Symbiotic Entity</LSTag>.

You gain three Star Maps per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, which allow you to cast while under the guidance of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ShapeoftheCosmos">Shapes of the Cosmos</LSTag>.
The number of times you can assume the form of a Wild Shape, or cast Spells as a Dryad.

The connection to nature gives way to serenity.
Feel and become as one.
Used for various actions while assuming the form of an Owlbear.
Used to gain a bit of luck while assuming the form of a Cat.

As a Druid, you may assume the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>. Toggling this passive allows you to Wildshape using either your <LSTag Tooltip="Action">Action</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>. This may be toggled at any time.
Magically assume the shape of a beast.

While assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, you cannot speak or cast Spells. You take on the attributes of your beast form - excluding your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> scores. Equipped items will still apply to you while assuming the form of a Wild Shape.

Once per turn, while assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> and after having made an unarmed or weapon based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your main hand, you may make an additional attack for free.
At the end of combat, immediately return to your natural form and refund one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charge. This can be toggled at any time.
You attune yourself to nature through four distinct elements - air, earth, fire, and water. Through their balance, you draw strength and fortitude.

Each turn while in combat, you cycle through one of the four seasons. Each season grants two passive damage buffs equal to your levels in Druid divided by two, as well as damage Resistances corresponding to your seasonal damage types.

In addition, each season allows you to morph into a corresponding elemental Myrmidon.

Affected creature is attuned to the season of Spring. They deal additional Lightning and Thunder damage equal to their levels in Druid divided by two and are Resistant to those types of damage as well.

In addition, they may morph into a Air Myrmidon at any time as a free action.

Affected creature is attuned to the season of Summer. They deal additional Fire and Radiant damage equal to their levels in Druid divided by two and are Resistant to those types of damage as well.

In addition, they may morph into a Fire Myrmidon at any time as a free action.

Affected creature is attuned to the season of Fall. They deal additional Poison and Necrotic damage equal to their levels in Druid divided by two and are Resistant to those types of damage as well.

In addition, they may morph into a Earth Myrmidon at any time as a free action.

Affected creature is attuned to the season of Winter. They deal additional Cold and Force damage equal to their levels in Druid divided by two and are Resistant to those types of damage as well.

In addition, they may morph into a Water Myrmidon at any time as a free action.
Shift into a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape_Myrmidon_Air">Air Myrmidon</LSTag> as a free action.
Shift into a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape_Myrmidon_Fire">Fire Myrmidon</LSTag> as a free action.
Shift into a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape_Myrmidon_Earth">Earth Myrmidon</LSTag> as a free action.
Shift into a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape_Myrmidon_Water">Water Myrmidon</LSTag> as a free action.

The first time each turn that you deal damage with a Spell associated with your seasonal damage types, you gain one use of Seasonal Reprieve.

The next time that you cast a Spell which deals those same types of damage, your Seasonal Reprieve is spent in place of a Spell Slot.
Cast your next Spell dealing either Lightning or Thunder damage without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Cast your next Spell dealing either Fire or Radiant damage without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Cast your next Spell dealing either Necrotic or Poison damage without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Cast your next Spell dealing either Cold or Force damage without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Affected creature may cast their next Spell dealing either Lightning or Thunder damage without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Affected creature may cast their next Spell dealing either Fire or Radiant damage without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Affected creature may cast their next Spell dealing either Necrotic or Poison damage without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Affected creature may cast their next Spell dealing either Cold or Force damage without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.

Gain the ability to manually advance your seasons by expending a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wildshape Charge</LSTag>, dealing damage within a [1] area. The damage type dealt changes to match the season that you had upon advancing.

Manually advance your season, dealing damage to all enemies within a [1] area in the process.

The damage type this deals both changes to match the season that you are currently in, as well as whether or not your target succeeds their Saving Throw.
While in combat, you ignore all forms of damage <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistances</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunities</LSTag> associated with your current season.

Upon landing a killing blow or Critical Hit, you immediately trigger Tempestuous Seasons within a [1] around your target.

Triggering Tempestuous Seasons in this way will not advance your season.
At the beginning of each turn in combat, you immediately recover all of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wildshape Charges</LSTag>.

A bond between you and your Dryad has taken root. Their stats increase for each of your Druid levels and due to their affinity with nature, their Spells may be cast without expending Spell Slots.

In addition, your Dryad will gain various passive effects depending on the passives that you receive while leveling.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> As a Dryad, your Spells are fueled by nature around you. As such, casting Spells does not require a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Summon a woodland Dryad. The Dryad grows in strength alongside you as you level within the Circle of the Land.
Creatures that you damage must succeed a Strength based <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED_VINES">Entangled</LSTag>.
Creatures that you damage must succeed a Strength based <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED_VINES">Entangled</LSTag>.

Creatures affected by your <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Ensnaring_Presence">Ensnaring Presence</LSTag> suffer <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> when rolling against your <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. Additionally, creatures that your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ConjureDryad">Dryad</LSTag> damages must succeed a Strength based <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED_VINES">Entangled</LSTag>.
Affected creature rolls with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on all <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against the Druid who applied this status.

Once per combat encounter, you may cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Entangle">Entangle</LSTag> as a third level Spell without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>. Additionally, all Spells cast by your Dryad are now cast as a second level Spell.
At the beginning of each of your turns, create a [1] area of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED_VINES">Entangling Vines</LSTag>. This can be toggled at any time.

You are unaffected by <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>, as well as your allies during combat. Additionally, your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ConjureDryad">Dryad</LSTag> creates a [2] area of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED_VINES">Entangling Vines</LSTag> at the beginning of each of its turns.
Affected creature is unaffected by <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>.
Heal a creature you can see within the nurturing vines of nature.

Upon landing a killing blow, conjure a [1] patch of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED_VINES">Entangling Vines</LSTag> beneath your targets corpse for three turns. This can be toggled at any time. Additionally, all Spells cast by your Dryad are now cast as a third level Spell.

Upon landing a killing blow, conjure a [1] patch of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED_VINES">Entangling Vines</LSTag> beneath your targets corpse for three turns. This can be toggled at any time.
Each turn, restore one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charge.

Creatures affected by your <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Ensnaring_Presence">Ensnaring Presence</LSTag> produce an aura across [1] which <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLESS">Blesses</LSTag> both you and your allies.
Affected creature is perpetually <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLESS">Blessing</LSTag> enemies within [1] for as long as they remain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED_VINES">Entangled</LSTag>.

You gain access to all <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> forms. While assuming the form of a Wild Shape, you are able to swap to any form as a free action. When swapping to another Wild Shape form in this manner, you retain the same percentage of <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> of the form you had swapped from.
You are able to utilize your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag> in order to infuse your melee attacks with additional elemental damage.
Infuse the elemental surroundings of nature into your body, causing your attack to deal an additional [1].
While assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, you ignore all physical <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistances</LSTag> when dealing damage.
While assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> is doubled.

Once per turn, while assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> and after having made an unarmed or weapon based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> with your main hand, you may make two additional attacks for free.
Gain the ability to grant yourself <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HASTE">Haste</LSTag> at will using a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> Charge.

Spike your adrenaline while in combat, granting yourself the ability to exert beyond your physical limits. While Hastened, you are able to make one action per turn without expending your Action, Bonus Action, or Reaction.

These Hastened actions generate a stack of Exhaustion, and Exhaustion stacks are also generated when damaged. All Attack Rolls made against Exhausted creatures are rolled with Advantage, and should a creature reach ten stacks of Exhaustion, they immediately fall Unconscious for three turns.
Point used to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_SymbioticEntity">Symbiotic Entity</LSTag>.
Gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HaloOfSpores">Halo of Spores</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_SymbioticEntity">Symbiotic Entity</LSTag>.
Unleash a cloud of necrotic spores upon a target.

Gain [1]. While you have Temporary Hit Points active, you deal an additional [2] when dealing damage. Additionally, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HaloOfSpores">Halo of Spores</LSTag> will deal double damage while active.

Affected creature deals an additional [2], and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HaloOfSpores">Halo of Spores</LSTag> will deal double damage, so long as they have <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">Temporary Hit Points</LSTag>.
Raise a mildewed, mold-encrusted zombie from a corpse.

Release concentrated spores at a corpse to magically reanimate it as a fungal servant. Animated creatures cannot be directly controlled, but retain all capabilities they had in life. Animating Spores are uniquely capable of reanimating most corpses, provided they are still intact.

Dangerous foes may only be reanimated by the most powerful within your Circle.
Affected creature has been reanimated by spores, their body completely infested and puppeteered. They are <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Fire.
While <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_SymbioticEntity">Symbiotic Entity</LSTag> is active, you may create a pocket of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SpreadingSpores">Spreading Spores</LSTag>.
Seed an area in deadly spores that deal [1] per turn to all creatures that inhale them except for you and your allies.
These virulent spores deal [1] to any who inhale them, with the exception of the Druid that propagated them and their allies.
Affected creature is inhaling dry, throat-closing spores that deal [1] per turn.

Upon landing a killing blow or <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, you create a pocket of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SpreadingSpores">Spreading Spores</LSTag>. In addition, You are now capable of animating <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="Tooltip_Dangerous_Encounter">Dangerous</LSTag> foes through <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_AnimatingSporesPlayer7">Sovereign Spores</LSTag>.

Release concentrated spores at a corpse to magically reanimate it as a fungal servant. Animated creatures cannot be directly controlled, but retain all capabilities they had in life. Sovereign Spores are uniquely capable of reanimating nearly any corpse, provided they are still intact.

Sovereign Spores are capable of reanimating Dangerous foes, but there is talk of those within your Circle who may be able to reanimate the strongest creatures imaginable...
Upon landing a killing blow or <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, you gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SYMBIOTIC_ENTITY">Symbiotic Entity</LSTag>.
You are now capable of animating <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Fatal_Encounter">Fatal</LSTag> foes through <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_AnimatingSporesPlayer11">Ascended Spores</LSTag>.

Release concentrated spores at any corpse to magically reanimate it as a fungal servant. Animated creatures cannot be directly controlled, but retain all capabilities they had in life.

Ascended Spores are uniquely capable of reanimating any corpse, provided they are still intact.
You are guided by the infinite mysteries of the cosmos. It is through your understanding of the stars that your druidic magic gains its potency.
A map of the stars you can use as a resource to cast while under the guidance of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ShapeoftheCosmos">Shapes of the Cosmos</LSTag>.

You may expend a Bonus Action in order to take on a Shape of the Cosmos rather than transforming into a beast. The first time you do so each combat encounter may be done without expending any resources.

The Shapes of the Cosmos available to you are that of the Archer, the Chalice, and the Dragon.
Take on a Shape of the Cosmos, allowing the constellation of a guiding figure to watch over you.
A constellation of an eagle-eyed archer guides you, allowing you to loose <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_StarryForm_Archer_Damage">Luminous Arrows</LSTag>.
Loose a luminous arrow upon a target of your choice.
Affected creature may loose a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_StarryForm_Archer_Damage">Luminous Arrow</LSTag>.
A constellation of a life-giving chalice guides you, allowing you to invoke <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_StarryForm_Chalice_Heal">Chalice Healing</LSTag>.
Heal a creature you can see.
Affected creature may invoke <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_StarryForm_Chalice_Heal">Chalice Healing</LSTag>.
A constellation of a wise dragon guides you, allowing you to exhale the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_StarryForm_Dragon_BreathWeapon">Breath of the Cosmos</LSTag>.
Exhale a dazzling field of stars.
Affected creature may exhale the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_StarryForm_Dragon_BreathWeapon">Breath of the Cosmos</LSTag>.
Expend one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> Charge in order to restore one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="StarMapPoint">Star Map</LSTag>.
While in combat, restore one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="StarMapPoint">Star Map</LSTag> every three turns.
Affected creature will recover one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="StarMapPoint">Star Map</LSTag> when this status expires.

Whenever you <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, you consult the stars for a Cosmic Omen of Weal or Woe. The omen grants you the ability to increase or decrease <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, and to increase your allies' <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
Omens of the future that you gain from consulting the stars. They let you affect the outcome of certain rolls.

Each of your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ShapeoftheCosmos">Shapes of the Cosmos</LSTag> now grant improved actions. Your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_StarryForm_Archer_Damage">Luminous Arrow</LSTag> may now target three creatures, invoking <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_StarryForm_Chalice_Heal">Chalice Healing</LSTag> can now heal within a [1] area, and your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_StarryForm_Dragon_BreathWeapon">Breath of the Cosmos</LSTag> is now much more concentrated, allowing it to travel significantly further.
Loose a barrage of luminous arrows upon three targets of your choice.
Heal all creatures within a [1] radius.
Expel a concentrated beam of starlight.

Each of your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ShapeoftheCosmos">Shapes of the Cosmos</LSTag> now grant an additional passive effect. The <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Wildshape_Star_Archer">Shape of the Archer</LSTag> now grants <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Wildshape_Star_Chalice">Shape of the Chalice</LSTag> now doubles its healing if your targets are below half of their total <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag>, and the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Wildshape_Star_Dragon">Shape of the Dragon</LSTag> now ensures the lowest you can roll on a <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> based <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> is 10.
All three of your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ShapeoftheCosmos">Shapes of the Cosmos</LSTag> are now passively active at all times.
Affected creature benefits from all <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ShapeoftheCosmos">Shapes of the Cosmos</LSTag> at all times.
Affected creature has embraced its druidic nature, allowing it to assume the form of a Wildshape.
Assume the shape of a giant badger that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Burrow_GiantBadger">Burrow</LSTag> into the ground.
Burrow into the ground and emerge at a target position, possibly knocking nearby creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Gain the ability to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Burrow_GiantBadger">Burrow</LSTag>, allowing you to move great distances without expending resources.
Assume the shape of a bear that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_GoadingRoar_Bear_Summon">Goad</LSTag> enemies into attacking it.
Assume the shape of a bear that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_GoadingRoar_Bear_Summon">Goad</LSTag> enemies into attacking it.
Roar at nearby enemies to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TAUNTED">Goad</LSTag> them into attacking you.
As a bear, you are resistant to even the harshest moments within combat. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to all physical damage.
Protect all allies within [1] of you, reducing the amount of damage they take from Spells and <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> by 4.
Affected creature is magically shielded, reducing the amount of damage they take from Spells and <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> by 4.
Take the shape of a cat that can avoid attention and distract enemies, forcing them to reroll <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Assume the shape of a deep rothé that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Rush_Rush_DeepRothe">Charge</LSTag> through multiple enemies.
Deals an additional [1] to targets with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DEBRIS_THRESHOLD_LESSER">Lesser Toughness</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DEBRIS_THRESHOLD">Medium Toughness</LSTag>.
Charge forward, attacking all enemies in the way and possibly knocking them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Each time that you deal damage, gain a +1 bonus to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> until the beginning of your next turn. This effect can stack.
Affected creature has received a +1 bonus to their <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> for each stack of Hard Headed that they have until the beginning of their next turn.

Take the shape of a dilophosaurus whose <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_CorrosiveSpit_Dilophosaurus">Corrosive Spit</LSTag> can dissolve a target's <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.
Spray a target with corrosive fluids that slowly melt away its <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.

Affected creature is covered in a corrosive fluid, reducing their <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by [1]. The fluid will keep eating away at its defences, further reducing its Armour Class, unless it is washed away with water.
Affected creature is covered in a corrosive fluid, reducing their <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by [1]. The fluid can be washed away with water.
The target's Armour Class decreases by [1] per turn, up to a maximum penalty of -[2]. Water removes the fluid and its effects.

When attacking a target under the affects of your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_CorrosiveSpit_Dilophosaurus">Corrosive Spit</LSTag>, you attack with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a dire raven that can avoid attention and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_RendVision_Raven_Summon">Blind</LSTag> enemies.
Attack a creature's eyes and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blind</LSTag> it.
Assume the shape of a dire wolf that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_Wolf_Dire_Wildshape">Expose</LSTag> enemies weak points.
Nip at a target to distract it, exposing a weak point. If your attack hits, the next attack against the target from within [1] will be a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>.
Creature is distracted. The next attack against this creature from within [1] is guaranteed to be a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>.
Each ally within earshot can move twice as far during their next turn.
Assume the shape of a giant spider that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Web_Spider">Enweb</LSTag> enemies.

Take the shape of a saber-tooth that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_RipandShred_SaberTooth_Tiger">Shred Armour</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Wildshape_Sabertooth_AnimalisticVitality">Regenerate</LSTag>.
Rip into a target's weaknesses, reducing their <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by [1].
Take the shape of a panther that can turn invisible with its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Prowl_Panther">Prowl</LSTag>.
Turn <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> while stalking your prey. While Invisible, your first attack deals an additional +[1] damage.
Leap at a target to bite it and knock it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
As an apex predator, you take advantage of every opening. When attacking an enemy who is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>, you deal an additional +1d6 damage.
Jump exceptionally far due to your Wildshape.
Affected creature is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag>. Their next attack will deal an additional +[1] damage.

Take the shape of an owlbear that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Owlbear_Wildshape_Smash">Rupture</LSTag> the ground and become <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Owlbear_Wildshape_Enrage">Enraged</LSTag>.
Rupture the earth, causing debris to tear through nearby objects and creatures.
Leap at a target to knock it and all nearby enemies <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Give in to your animalistic instinct and increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> by [1], possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Terrifying</LSTag> all nearby creatures.
Affected creature is enraged! Their <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> has increased by [1].
Upon landing a killing blow or <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, restore one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage Charge</LSTag>.

Take the shape of an air myrmidon that can <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stun</LSTag> targets with an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_LightningStrike_Myrmidon_Air">Electrified Flail</LSTag> and lock them down within a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_RagingVortex_Myrmidon_Air">Raging Vortex</LSTag>.
Clout a foe with your lightning-suffused flail, potentially <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunning</LSTag> them.
Call upon your innate connection to nature and warp to an unoccupied space that you can see.
Spiral the wind into a choking maelstrom that inflicts [1] per turn to any creatures within. Escaping requires a successful Strength based <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
Affected creature takes [1] per turn while remaining in the vortex. Escape demands a successful Strength based <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
Affected creature is being dealt [1] per turn while remaining in the vortex.
As a manifestation of one of natures core elements, you are always capable of flight, rather than jumping.
As a manifestation of one of natures core elements, you are <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to Lightning and Thunder damage.

Take the shape of an earth myrmidon that can increase it's <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by casting <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_MetalCoating_Myrmidon_Earth">Transmute Steel</LSTag> and obliterate nearby enemies with a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_MudSlap_Myrmidon_Earth">Seismic Slam</LSTag>.
Wallop a foe with fists of stone.
Harden your body into a substance like steel, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by [1] until your next turn.
Overwhelm nearby creatures with painfully heavy sludge, miring the area around yourself in thick mud.
As a manifestation of one of natures core elements, you are always capable of flight, rather than jumping.
As a manifestation of one of natures core elements, you are <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to Acid and Poison damage.

Take the shape of a fire myrmidon that can erupt foes in a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_RangedSwipe_Myrmidon_Fire">Cinderous Inferno</LSTag> and retaliate against attackers with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HellishRebuke_Myrmidon">Hellfire's Rebuke</LSTag>.
Conjure a mighty eruption of fire.
React to your next attacker with hellish flames that deal [1].
As a manifestation of one of natures core elements, you are always capable of flight, rather than jumping.
As a manifestation of one of natures core elements, you are <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to Fire and Radiant damage.

Take the shape of a water myrmidon that can heal or destroy with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_HealingMist_Myrmidon_Water">Elemental Vapours</LSTag> and pierce enemies with an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_ExplosiveIcicle_Myrmidon_Water">Snap Freeze</LSTag>.
Hurl a ball forged of glistening ice that explodes and creates an ice surface on impact.
Exude water vapour from your body, healing nearby creatures, or savaging them if you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poisoned</LSTag>.
If Poisoned, the vapour will instead deal [1].
As a manifestation of one of natures core elements, you are always capable of flight, rather than jumping.
As a manifestation of one of natures core elements, you are <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to Cold and Force damage.

Shifting foliage masked many moons of experience within you.
Unearth them now, that they may provide perspective.
When a creature damages you with a melee based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, deal Piercing damage to them equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Wisdom Modifier</LSTag>.
At the beginning of any combat encounter, cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Goodberry">Goodberry</LSTag>.
When you roll a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a Spell, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PETRIFIED">Petrify</LSTag> your target for one turn.

Gain a +2 bonus to all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. This bonus is doubled while assuming a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ShapeoftheCosmos">Shape of the Cosmos</LSTag>, or while <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SYMBIOTIC_ENTITY">Symbiotic Entity</LSTag> is active.

Upon assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">Temporary Hit Points</LSTag> equal to your Druid level multiplied by four.

Gain a +1 bonus to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>. This bonus is doubled while assuming a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ShapeoftheCosmos">Shape of the Cosmos</LSTag>, or while <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SYMBIOTIC_ENTITY">Symbiotic Entity</LSTag> is active.
While assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, you gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to all physical damage.
Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all damage rolls while assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>.

While not assuming the form of a Wild Shape, you may expend <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charges in order to restore <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag>. Additionally, gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape_Combat_Heal">Lunar Mend</LSTag>, allowing you to heal yourself while in the form of a Wild Shape.
Call upon your connection to nature in order to restore your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag>.

Spend a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charge in order to restore a level one <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>. Upon reaching level three in Druid, this action will also restore a level two Spell Slot.

Spend 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charges in order to restore a level three <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>. Upon reaching level seven in Druid, this action will also restore a level four Spell Slot.

Spend 3 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charges in order to restore a level five <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>. Upon reaching level eleven in Druid, this action will also restore a level six Spell Slot.
Required for Mantra of Restoration to function properly. You should not be able to see this.

Expend <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag> in order to regain <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> while assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>.
Expend a Level 1 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> to heal yourself.
Expend a Level 2 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> to heal yourself.
Expend a Level 3 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> to heal yourself.
Expend a Level 4 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> to heal yourself.
Expend a Level 5 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> to heal yourself.
Expend a Level 6 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> to heal yourself.

Once per turn, upon landing a killing blow or rolling a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> on an enemy, restore one of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charges.

Once per turn, upon landing a killing blow or rolling a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> on an enemy, restore one of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charges.

While in combat, regenerate <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> each turn equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Wisdom Modifier</LSTag>. This passive has no effect while <LSTag Tooltip="Downed">Downed</LSTag>.
Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Cold, Fire, and Lightning damage.

Use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charges to deal an additional +1d12 Cold, Lightning, or Poison damage on any successful <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> made with a weapon.

While assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, damaging other creatures potentially <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TAUNTED">Goads</LSTag> them into attacking you.

While assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ShapeoftheCosmos">Shape of the Cosmos</LSTag>, or while <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SYMBIOTIC_ENTITY">Symbiotic Entity</LSTag> is active, you have a chance to inflict <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GAPING_WOUND">Gaping Wounds</LSTag> on your target when you make a successful <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.
Deal additional damage while <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shaped</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Wisdom Modifier</LSTag>.

While assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ShapeoftheCosmos">Shape of the Cosmos</LSTag>, or while <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SYMBIOTIC_ENTITY">Symbiotic Entity</LSTag> is active, you have a chance to knock your target <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> when you make a successful <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.
Outside of combat, you may <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> as a free action.

Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> when making an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against a target in <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>.
While in combat, regenerate one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charge every three turns.
Affected creature will recover one <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag> charge when this status expires.
